column1: The children had explored the gardens and the outhouses thoroughly before they were caught and cleaned for tea
column2: and they saw quite well that they were certain to be happy at the White House. They thought so from the first moment
column3: but when they found the back of the house covered with jasmine
column5: and smelling like a bottle of the most expensive scent that is ever given for a birthday present; and when they had seen the lawn
column7: and quite different from the brown grass in the gardens at Camden Town; and when they had found the stable with a loft over it and some old hay still left
column8: they were almost certain; and when Robert had found the broken swing and tumbled out of it and got a lump on his head the size of an egg
column9: and Cyril had nipped his finger in the door of a hutch that seemed made to keep rabbits in
column11: they had no longer any doubts whatever.
